gameMembers

Class EnvironmentMember

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameMembers.Drawable
      • gameMembers.EnvironmentMember
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BasicEnemy, Bullet, Door, Item, PlayButton, Player

    public abstract class EnvironmentMember
extends Drawable
    EnvironmentMember
    This class is inherited by anything that's a part of the environment. It gives a hitbox method (for collision) and a method to move the object when the camera moves.
    Use this class for anything that may interact with the character. If it's part of the UI, make it a Drawable instead.
    Author:
    Hughes
    See Also:
    Drawable

    • Constructor Detail

      • EnvironmentMember

        public EnvironmentMember(float x,
                         float y,
                         java.lang.String imagePath,
                         float scale)
        The constructor for the class. Gives initial values to all of the instance variables.
        x and y are the location of the object (inherited from Drawable).
        String imagePath is the path of the image for this EnvironmentMember.
        float scale is the scale of the Image for the character (for example, 0.5 would make the character's Image and hitbox half of their size at scale = 1)
        Parameters:
        x - the initial starting x coordinate for the object
        y - the initial starting y coordinate for the object
        imagePath - the location of the Image for the object
        scale - the initial scale of the Image when it's displayed on the screen (also changes the hitbox)

    • Method Detail

      • getHitbox

        public java.awt.Rectangle[] getHitbox()
        Gives a hitbox for the character. Makes collision detection somewhat easier.

        This hitbox is in the form of a an array of Java.awt.Rectangle. The relevant constructor for the Rectangle is
        (int xLoc, int yLoc, int xLength, int yLength).

        This class is used because of its intersects method:

        if(p.getHitBox().intersects(g.getHitbox))

        is the intended use for the Rectangle. This is baked in and makes collision a lot easier.

        Returns:
        r the Rectangle hitbox of the EnvironmentMember

      • intersects

        public boolean intersects(EnvironmentMember e)
        This method should be used to determine if 2 EnvironmentMember objects are colliding with each other. Since the hitbox is defined as an array, it's useful to have this one baked in method.
        This method might have to be rewritten, but for now this works fine.
        Parameters:
        e - the EnvironmentMember to be checked against for collision
        Returns:
        whether or not an intersection is occurring

      • getImage

        public org.newdawn.slick.Image getImage()
        getImage
        This Image represents the EnvironmentMember graphically.
        It's meant to link directly to the source of the image, rather than a scaled down copy of it. float scale exists for this purpose.
        Returns:
        the characterImage of this class

      • draw

        public void draw(org.newdawn.slick.Graphics g)
        This method is inherited from the Drawable class. This implementation takes a Graphics object when called and uses it to draw the object on the screen. The intended use of this method is to be able to draw an entire ArrayList or Drawable[] and draw the entire thing using a simple loop:

        for(Drawable d : drawables)
        d.draw
        Specified by:
        draw in class Drawable
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics object required to draw

      • changeScaleRelativeToScreen

        public void changeScaleRelativeToScreen(float scale)
        This method should be called when the screen's scale changes (e.g. the camera zooms out or in.) It modifies the x and y values inherited from Drawable to fit the new scale and changes the scale of the Image to make it look ok as well.
        Parameters:
        scale - The amount that the screen is being scaled by (e.g. .75 reduces the size of this object by 25% from 100%, but if you set the scale to .75 again nothing will happen)

      • getScale

        public float getScale()
        float scale is the scale of the Image representing the EnvironmentMember. This is useful for changing the size of the character with respect to the screen
        Returns:
        the scale of the character

      • setScale

        public void setScale(float scale)

      • getCenter

        public Point getCenter()
        Returns the center point of the EnvironmentMember.
        Normally Characters are defined by their corner coordinates but occasionally it is useful to get the center coordinates.
        Returns:
